174.article_body: Arjun Deshpande, a young entrepreneur whose pharma startup Generic Aadhaar received investment from Ratan Tata, recently took to social media to share a picture with the Chairman Emeritus of Tata Sons. "In every meet, there are new learnings and motivation for me and I am truly blessed to have Ratan Tata Sir as my Mentor," Deshpande captioned the picture.

175.title: Are you okay?: US Starbucks staff leaves message for girl approached by stranger
175.article_body: A Starbucks employee wrote a message on a cup for an 18-year-old US girl who was approached by an unknown man at the cafe. It read, "Are you okay? Do you want us to intervene? If you do, take the lid off the cup." However, the girl didn't need any intervention and she let the staff know she was okay.

176.title: Brown sugar worth ₹1.22 crore seized in Odisha, 1 arrested
176.article_body: The Special Task Force (STF) of the Odisha Police seized 1.227 kg of brown sugar worth ₹1.22 crore and arrested a wanted drug peddler, the police said on Tuesday. The STF raided a place near the Pahal crossing in Khordha district and seized the drugs. A bike and five mobile phones were also recovered from the possession of the accused.

177.title: Adopt common policy to rescue street kids: SC tells states & UTs
177.article_body: The Supreme Court (SC) on Monday called for a common policy for rehabilitation of children living on the streets. The SC directed states and Union Territories (UT) to frame measures based on suggestions of National Commission for Protection of Child Rights (NCPCR). NCPCR's suggestion requires states to locate hotspots in every district to identify, rescue and rehabilitate street children.

178.title: Turkey condemns Russian recognition of Ukraine separatist regions
178.article_body: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan on Tuesday said Russian recognition of Ukraine's separatist regions, Donetsk and Luhansk is unacceptable. "We repeat our call for common sense and respect for international law by all sides," Erdogan said. This comes after Russian President Vladimir Putin ordered a "peacekeeping operation" in both the regions after recognising their independence on Monday.

179.title: Hong Kong to undergo 3 rounds of compulsory COVID testing in March
179.article_body: Hong Kong Chief Executive Carrie Lam on Tuesday said residents will undergo three rounds of compulsory COVID-19 testing in March. "Those who do not take the universal test will be held liable," added Lam. As experts predicted 1.8 lakh daily cases next month, government will enforce strict rules until mid-April. Meanwhile, authorities reported 6,211 new cases, 32 deaths on Tuesday.

180.title: Tourists to get free entry to Taj Mahal during Shah Jahan's Urs
180.article_body: Tourists will get free entry to Taj Mahal from February 27 to March 1 on the occasion of Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan's Urs. On February 27 and 28, the entry will be free from 2 pm till sunset, Raj Kumar Patel, Superintending Archaeologist (Agra Circle), said. On March 1, the entry will be free from sunrise to sunset, Patel added.

181.title: 3 men rob items worth ₹44 lakh from truck driver at gunpoint, held
181.article_body: Hyderabad Police have arrested three men who robbed a truck driver of property worth ₹44 lakh at gunpoint after asking for a lift. The incident reportedly took place on February 17 when the driver was travelling from Tamil Nadu to Haryana. According to Rachakonda Police, the suspects made the driver halt the truck on the way and robbed him.

182.title: Illegal: HC on govt orders allowing only fully-vaccinated in Mumbai trains
182.article_body: The Bombay High Court on Tuesday said the Maharashtra government's 2021 orders allowing only those fully-vaccinated against COVID-19 to board Mumbai local trains was illegal. "The fundamental rights of citizens were brazenly affected," HC said. Later, the government's lawyer said it will take a decision on withdrawing the prohibition or imposing it after assessing the COVID-19 situation.

183.title: 4 people arrested in Raj Kundra porn case, 3 of them accused of raping an actress
183.article_body: Four more people, including a casting director, have been arrested from Versova and Borivali areas in Raj Kundra pornography case, said Mumbai Police's Crime Branch. As per Mid-Day, three of them are accused of raping an actress during the shooting of a web series. The casting director forcefully brought the actress to a bungalow for the shoot, the report said.

184.title: No plan to ban blockchain use in non-crypto areas: Finance Secretary
184.article_body: Finance Secretary TV Somanathan has said that there need not be any apprehension about anyone using blockchain technology in an area that has nothing to do with payments or cryptocurrencies. "The government's policy towards blockchain has nothing to do with its policy on crypto assets...[it] has nothing against blockchain technology and there's no connection between the two," he further said.

185.title: Govt analysing whether SEBI took adequate measures in NSE case: FM
185.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said the government is studying the National Stock Exchange (NSE) matter to see if SEBI has taken "necessary punitive" action over it. She added the government won't tolerate any doubt over the credibility of the institutions. Ex-NSE MD and CEO Chitra Ramkrishna is accused of providing confidential information to an "unidentified Himalayan Yogi".

186.title: Jasprit Bumrah can walk into any T20 team in the world: Gavaskar
186.article_body: Sunil Gavaskar said Jasprit Bumrah will walk into any T20 team adding that Deepak Chahar is a "terrific" swing bowler with extra pace. Bumrah missed India's T20I series against West Indies which India won 3-0 but will return for the T20I series against Sri Lanka. "India are blessed as far as riches in bowling are concerned," stated Gavaskar.

187.title: 8 Assam residents held by gang on pretext of jobs rescued from Guj
187.article_body: Eight Assam residents, including three minor boys and girls, who were being held by a gang on the pretext of providing them jobs have been rescued from Gujarat. The victims were rescued from a train by the Sashastra Seema Bal (SSB) on Tuesday. The gang had reportedly taken one year's salary of ₹5 lakh from them.

188.title: Heroes come and go but legends are forever: Waqar on Wasim Akram
188.article_body: Reacting to Wasim Akram being inducted into Pakistan Cricket Board's (PCB) Hall of Fame, former Pakistan pacer Waqar Younis tweeted, "Heroes come and go but legends are forever. Tribute to the legend." "Thanks buddy. Wouldn't have been possible without you," read the reaction from Akram. Akram is the first player to be inducted into the PCB Hall of Fame.

189.title: Policewoman having affair with married naib-tehsildar killed in UP; official, wife held
189.article_body: A 25-year-old policewoman, who was allegedly having an affair with a married naib-tehsildar, was found murdered in a drain in Uttar Pradesh. The naib-tehsildar and his wife have been arrested in connection with the murder. Police said that during interrogation the accused couple admitted to the crime, adding that the victim was pressurising him to marry her.

190.title: Unmanned barricades serve no purpose, cause harassment to public: Delhi HC
190.article_body: Over the presence of unmanned barricades on roads, Delhi High Court has asked the Delhi Police to submit the protocol followed by it for placing barricades in the national capital. It said, "[Unmanned] blockades on...roads...serve no purpose and...cause inconvenience and harassment to...public." "Such barricades are also being used to set up and run kiosks or parking vehicles," it added.

191.title: All nations should unite against terrorism: LS Speaker Birla in UAE
191.article_body: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla on Tuesday, while addressing the Federal National Council of UAE in Abu Dhabi, emphasised the need for nations to unite to fight terrorism. Condemning the recent terror attack in UAE, he added, "The shared concern of India and UAE with regard to...increasing threats from religious extremism and terrorism...is reshaping cooperation between the two countries."

192.title: Won't hold back in exposing journalist's name if repetition happens: Saha on threats
192.article_body: Wicketkeeper-batter Wriddhiman Saha has said that he shared the screenshot of threatening WhatsApp messages sent to him by a journalist as he was hurt and offended. "On grounds of humanity looking at his/her family, I am not exposing the name for the time being. But if any such repetition happens, I will not hold back," Saha added.

193.title: It was surreal to see Kohli, Rohit put in the hard yards: PBKS' Shahrukh
193.article_body: Discussing his experience with the Indian team, PBKS all-rounder Shahrukh Khan termed it "surreal" to see Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma put in the hard yards "day in day out". "They never skip a net session. Their professionalism reminds me...there's no substitute for hard work," added Shahrukh. Shahrukh was added to India's squad for the first ODI against West Indies.

194.title: Snow control room set up in Srinagar to monitor snowfall levels
194.article_body: A snow control room, equipped with the latest machinery, has been set up in J&K's Srinagar to monitor snowfall levels and to respond to any emergency calls during a snowstorm. Abdul Rashid Dar, Chief Engineer Mechanical Division Kashmir said, "This control room automatically starts working whenever snowfall starts here." Around 11-12 machines to clear snowfall are currently installed, he added.

195.title: UK imposes sanctions on 5 key Russian banks, freezes assets of 3 Putin aides
195.article_body: The UK has announced the first sanctions against Russia in connection to the situation in Ukraine by targeting five key Russian banks and three allies of Russian President Vladimir Putin. The individuals targeted in the sanctions have a high net worth and any assets they have in the UK will be frozen, PM Boris Johnson said.

196.title: Need to ramp up COVID-19 vaccination: Maha CM Uddhav Thackeray
196.article_body: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Tuesday said that there is a need to ramp up vaccinations at this time while the cases are declining as the pandemic is not over yet. Terming the vaccines as "suraksha kawach" (protective shield), he said it reduces the severity of the coronavirus infection. He further said that it's still necessary to wear a mask.

197.title: PM Modi to inaugurate 100 new electric buses in Pune next month
197.article_body: PM Narendra Modi will inaugurate 100 new electric buses of the Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited (PMPML) next month. PMPML Chairman Laxminarayan Mishra said March 6 is the tentative date for the inauguration. As many as 200 diesel buses will be scrapped and 100 e-buses will replace them, Mishra added.

198.title: HDFC bank sets up oxygen plant at KC General Hospital in B'luru: Minister
198.article_body: Karnataka's Health Minister Dr K Sudhakar on Tuesday informed that HDFC bank has set up an oxygen plant at KC General Hospital in Bengaluru under its "Parivartan CSR initiative". Applauding the "kind gesture of HDFC", Sudhakar said, "These generous contributions have been instrumental in bringing quantitative and qualitative change in our critical care infrastructure amid [COVID-19] pandemic."

199.title: MP govt lifts all COVID-19 restrictions amid dip in daily cases
199.article_body: The Madhya Pradesh government on Tuesday ended all restrictions imposed due to COVID-19 amid a decline in cases. CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan underlined that night curfew will end from midnight. "The positivity rate has come down to less than 1%. I request all citizens to follow COVID-19 appropriate behaviour," he added. MP had recorded 847 new COVID-19 cases on Monday.

200.title: Gas leaks for over 30 minutes from underground pipeline in Pune
200.article_body: A major accident was averted in Pune after Pune Municipal Corporation, fire department and Maharashtra Natural Gas Limited (MNGL) managed to plug a gas leak due to rupture of an underground pipeline on Tuesday. The leakage, which occurred in the Shirole Road area, continued for over 30 minutes. The pipeline ruptured accidentally due to construction activities, a resident said.

201.title: Madonna shares heavily-filtered pics of 'baby face', fans react
201.article_body: Singer Madonna took to Instagram to share pictures of herself having wine and vaping with the caption, "Tryin' to make a movie. It's really hard!" The 63-year-old singer used beauty filters on the pictures which concealed any wrinkles on her skin and gave her 'baby face'. An Instagram user commented, "Stop using those youth filters," while another wrote, "So creepy."

202.title: Britney Spears signs $15 million book deal for tell-all memoir
202.article_body: Singer Britney Spears has signed a $15 million (over ₹112 crore) book deal with publishing house Simon & Schuster for a tell-all memoir about her conservatorship. As per a report, Simon & Schuster secured the deal after a bidding war involving multiple publishers. This comes three months after Britney's 13-year long conservatorship under her father Jamie Spears was terminated.

203.title: We're used to it: Russia on US' 'mother of all sanctions' threat over Ukraine
203.article_body: Reacting to the 'mother of all sanctions' proposed by the US Senate against Russia over the Ukraine conflict, Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said, "Well, we're used to it." He added, "Our European, American, British colleagues will not stop and will not calm down until they have exhausted all their possibilities for the so-called 'punishment of Russia'."

204.title: COVID-19 mandates to ease once Omicron peaks in NZ: PM Ardern
204.article_body: New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern on Monday said COVID-19 mandates like vaccine passes and social distancing measures will ease once Omicron passes its peak. For two weeks thousands of protesters against COVID-19 mandates, inspired by Canada's "Freedom Convoy", have blocked streets near the parliament. Eight protesters on Monday were arrested for disorderly behaviour and obstruction.

205.title: He's a Rolls-Royce: Dawson on Liverpool defender Virgil van Dijk
205.article_body: Calling Virgil van Dijk a "Rolls-Royce", ex-England defender Michael Dawson said the Liverpool defender has got everything. "He's big, strong...quick. We talk about defenders not wanting to get in wide areas. He can defend anywhere on...pitch on his own," he added. Liverpool are currently second in Premier League standings, six points behind leaders Manchester City with a game in hand.

206.title: We have to work to turn India into Golden India: T'gana CM KC Rao
206.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao said his vision is to make a "Bangaru Bharata Desam" (Golden India) on the lines of Bangaru Telangana. "We have built Bangaru Telangana. Now we have to better the conditions in the country by transforming it into Bangaru Bharata Desam," Rao said. India must become a role model of development for other countries, he added.

207.title: B'luru man conspires with criminal to get rid of son's live-in partner
207.article_body: A man allegedly conspired with a rowdy-sheeter to get rid of his son's live-in partner in Bengaluru. He reportedly gave the 25-year-old woman's private pictures to the rowdy-sheeter, who sent them to the woman's father and later threatened to viral her pictures if she didn't leave Bengaluru. Meanwhile, the rowdy-sheeter has been arrested and the man's role is being investigated.

208.title: PWD to redevelop accident-prone Rohtak Road at Tikri border
208.article_body: The accident-prone Rohtak Road (National Highway-10) at the Tikri border between Haryana and Delhi will be renovated by the Public Works Department (PWD). The road had sustained damage during the farmers' protest last year, according to officials. The estimated budget for the work is nearly ₹92 lakh and tenders for it have been issued, officials said.

209.title: Schools shut till Friday in Shivamogga over Bajrang Dal activist's murder
209.article_body: Amid tension due to the murder of Bajrang Dal activist Harsha, schools will remain shut till Friday morning in Karnataka's Shivamogga, Deputy Commissioner Dr Selvamani R said on Tuesday. Further, Section 144 was extended for two days and people's movement will be allowed from 6-9 am only. Six people were arrested and all of them reportedly have a criminal record.

210.title: Gurugram grocery store incharge shot at while resisting robbery bid
210.article_body: A grocery store incharge was shot at by unidentified men when he tried to stop them from robbing cash from the store in Gurugram. The accused then ran away from the shop. The victim suffered a gunshot wound in his stomach but his condition is stable, police said, adding that an FIR has been registered.

211.title: Dubai airport ranks world's busiest international airport; largest traffic from India
211.article_body: With 29.1 million passengers in 2021, Dubai International airport ranked as the world’s busiest airport for the eighth consecutive year. While December last year was the busiest month for the airport, the largest share of traffic to Dubai came from India, with 4.2 million travellers, followed by Pakistan, with 1.8 million travellers and Saudi Arabia with 1.5 million passengers.

212.title: Who are the 5 people to whom IDFC First Bank CEO gifted shares worth ₹3.95 cr?
212.article_body: IDFC First Bank CEO V Vaidyanathan on Monday gifted shares worth ₹3.95 crore to five people - his trainer Ramesh Raju, househelps Pranjal Narvekar and Santosh Jogale, driver Algarsamy C Munapar and office support staff Deepak Pathare, to purchase houses. In 2020, he gifted shares to his former mathematics teacher for lending him ₹500 when he was a broke student.

213.title: Pic of 3 galaxies merging 681 mn light-years away released by Hubble telescope
213.article_body: The Hubble Space Telescope has captured an image of the merger of three galaxies, that's happening 681 million light-years away from the Earth in the constellation Cancer, as per the European Space Agency. The image has shown a mixture of star formation and tidal distortions caused by the galaxies' gravitational interactions. The cosmic object is called IC 2431, Hubble said.

214.title: 18-yr-old Alcaraz becomes youngest to win ATP 500 event with Rio win
214.article_body: Spain's Carlos Alcaraz on Sunday became the youngest ever to win an ATP 500 title aged 18 after beating Argentina's Diego Schwartzman 6-4, 6-2 in the Rio Open final. "I can't believe it, honestly. It has been a great week for me playing a great level," Alcaraz said. He won his first ATP Tour match in Rio two years ago.

215.title: 44-ft-long temple pole crashes during installation in Andhra, video surfaces
215.article_body: A nearly 44-feet-long pole of a temple crashed during installation in Andhra Pradesh's Guntur district on Monday. A video shows two cranes supporting the pole when suddenly its top portion broke off. The onlookers ran to save themselves and reportedly no one was hurt in the incident. The new pole was being installed in place of an old one.

216.title: What happened to my heart was very strange: Aguero on his retirement
216.article_body: Former Barcelona forward Sergio Aguero, who had to retire at the age of 33 due to heart problems, has said that he will not be coming out of retirement for now. "It's like looking at something you know won't happen, at least for a while," Aguero stated. "What happened to my heart was very strange and sudden," he added.

217.title: South Korean TV personalities Jun Hyun-moo, Lee Hye-sung break up
217.article_body: The agency of South Korean television personalities Jun Hyun-moo and Lee Hye-sung has issued a statement revealing that the couple has broken up. "Although it was a personal relationship, the two people must have felt more worry and burden because it was a relationship revealed to the public," the statement read. The couple made the relationship official in November 2019.

218.title: There are consequences to his decisions: Murray on Novak's vaccine stance
218.article_body: Commenting on Novak Djokovic's COVID vaccination stance, three-time Grand Slam champion Andy Murray said there are consequences to the decisions he's made. "Yeah, he obviously has to accept that," he added. Earlier, world number one said he'd rather miss out on future trophies than be forced to get a COVID vaccine. "I don't agree with his decision," Murray further said.

219.title: BCCI changed split captaincy plans after Kohli quit as Test captain: Saba
219.article_body: Ex-India wicketkeeper Saba Karim said that the BCCI was forced to change their split captaincy plans due to Virat Kohli's sudden resignation from Test captaincy. "Kohli was not expected to leave the red-ball captaincy and because of his resignation, India had to make Rohit Sharma the skipper across formats," he stated. Saba also called Rohit an "ideal candidate" for captaincy.

220.title: World no. 1 Djokovic wins 1st match on return to tennis in Dubai
220.article_body: World number one Novak Djokovic on Monday beat Italian Lorenzo Musetti 6-3, 6-3 in Dubai to win his first match since being deported ahead of the Australian Open last month due to his vaccination status. Djokovic said last week he was willing to miss major tournaments rather than get vaccinated. Djokovic will face Alex de Minaur or Karen Khachanov next.

221.title: Our planes had right to watch Chinese ships in our waters: Australia
221.article_body: Australian PM Scott Morrison on Tuesday said Australian planes had the right to surveil Chinese ships in their waters. "The fact they were put under threat is extremely disappointing," added Morrison. This comes after China said the plane came too close to Chinese warships. On February 17, a Chinese warship allegedly used laser on an Australian plane potentially endangering lives.

222.title: Missing dog reunited with owner after 12 years despite being listed as 'dead' in US
222.article_body: 'Zoey', a dog reported missing in 2010, has reunited with her owner after 12 years in the US. Zoey had been missing for so long that in 2015, her tracking chip company's records listed her as 'deceased'. However, an animal services officer received a report about a stray dog and on tracking the chip, it turned out to be Zoey.

223.title: Farhan-Shibani attend wedding bash thrown by Zoya, pics surface
223.article_body: Actor-filmmaker Farhan Akhtar and wife Shibani Dandekar attended a wedding bash thrown by his sister filmmaker Zoya Akhtar on Monday evening. Pictures show Farhan dressed in all-black and Shibani wearing a purple gown. The party was also attended by Javed Akhtar, Shabana Azmi, Farah Khan, Anusha Dandekar and Rhea Chakraborty, among others. The couple got married on Saturday in Khandala.

224.title: We're keeping each other motivated: Deepti after 4th ODI loss vs NZ
224.article_body: Following a 63-run loss against New Zealand in the fourth ODI, India Women all-rounder Deepti Sharma has said that her side is keeping each other motivated. "Winning and losing is a part of the game...With the World Cup coming, we want to take as much confidence as possible forward to the last match of the series," Deepti stated.

225.title: Don't want to take anything away from Nadal's Aus Open win: Djokovic
225.article_body: Talking about Rafael Nadal's Australian Open 2022 win, Novak Djokovic said he has got a lot of respect for the player. "It was four, five months ago...Nadal was on the crutches and now he's winning a [Grand Slam]. It's incredible," Djokovic stated. "I don't want to take anything away from his victory, me not participating in...tournament regardless," he added.

226.title: Parts of Portugal, Spain, Italy hit by drought: European crop monitor
226.article_body: European crop monitor MARS on Monday said persistent rain deficits have led to droughts in Mediterranean countries of Portugal, Spain and Italy. MARS said the soil water content and irrigation reservoirs are well below the average amount indicating more harm to crops such as wheat and barley. On other hand, dry weather had a limited impact on rest of Europe.

227.title: India to send 1st wheat shipment to Afghanistan via Pakistan
227.article_body: India is set to send first shipment of wheat to Afghanistan overland through Pakistan on Tuesday. This is the first batch of 50,000 metric tonnes of wheat committed by government several months ago. Last week, India supplied 2.5 tons of medical assistance, winter clothing to the crisis-torn country. Afghanistan plunged into humanitarian crisis after Taliban took over in August 2021.

228.title: Under BJP rule, no one left without help in time of crisis: PM Modi
228.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday said the BJP government does not leave anyone without help in a time of crisis. "We opened up 'anna ka bhandaar' during the COVID-19 crisis, 80 crore people have been getting free ration for the last two years," PM Modi said. "Tough time calls for a tough leader," he added.

229.title: Winning WC would make a real difference for fans back home: Mithali
229.article_body: India Women ODI captain Mithali Raj said winning the upcoming Women's ODI World Cup will make a real difference for their fans in India. "Our fans are some of the most passionate in the world...I'm sure if we did win, we'd be able to hear them...from New Zealand," Mithali stated. The tournament will begin on March 4.

230.title: Former Gujarat Congress spokesperson Jayrajsinh Parmar joins BJP
230.article_body: Former Gujarat Congress spokesperson Jayrajsinh Parmar joined the BJP in presence of state party unit chief CR Paatil in Gandhinagar on Tuesday. Parmar, who was associated with Congress for 37 years, alleged that the party had sidelined him. "I'm not joining...BJP with an expectation of getting something in return. I have joined...BJP to fill up what's missing," he said.

231.title: Kerala Assembly Opp'n stages walkout over Lokayukta Amendment Act
231.article_body: The Opposition in Kerala Assembly on Tuesday staged a walkout after Speaker MB Rajesh rejected the adjournment motion to discuss Lokayukta Amendment Act. Leader of Opposition VD Satheesan said the amendments were made to protect Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan in four pending cases against him. "Fear has gripped the CM and hence the government put forward this amendment," Satheesan said.

232.title: Study reveals Milky Way's chemical history through new group of stars
232.article_body: Researchers published a new catalogue of over 24 million stars that could be used to reveal chemical history of Milky Way. Team measured light from each star to infer the amount of heavy metals such as iron. However, they also found stars which contained no elements heavier than hydrogen and helium indicating that they formed very early in universe's history.

233.title: 2 arrested as autos, motorcycle torched in Karnataka's Shivamogga
233.article_body: Two people have been taken into custody for allegedly torching two autos and a motorcycle in Karnataka's Shivamogga district. Minister-in-charge, KC Narayana Gowda, informed that an investigation into the incident, which happened on Tuesday, is underway. He further said the overall situation in the district is peaceful, adding, "The public shouldn't worry as...situation will normalise soon."

234.title: 2 students injured after fight break out outside Noida's Amity University
234.article_body: Two final year students of Amity University were injured after a clash broke out between them and a group of three people in Noida's sector 126 on Monday afternoon, police said. The two groups were having food at an eatery outside the university when an argument broke out, which turned violent, said Additional Deputy Commissioner of Police (Noida) Ranvijay Singh.

235.title: Shiv Sena adopts 6-yr-old who lost family in fire, the boy to live in Pune
235.article_body: Shiv Sena has adopted a six-year-old boy, whose three family members died in fire in November last year. Mumbai Mayor Kishori Pednekar said the boy has been granted financial aid of ₹15 lakh and the party will take care of his education. "He will live with his maternal grandfather in Pune," the Mayor said.

236.title: Hyd Police busts racket selling fake education certificates; 7 arrested
236.article_body: Hyderabad Police has busted a racket involved in selling fake education certificates and arrested seven persons, including students who collected the fake certificates. The accused used to collect information of dropouts, failed students and later used to approach them, promising to issue certificates. They demanded ₹2.50 lakh for BTech certificates and ₹80,000 for other courses from the students.

237.title: Jet Airways appoints Ex-SriLankan Airlines CEO Vipula Gunatilleka as CFO
237.article_body: Jalan-Kalrock Consortium, the promoters of Jet Airways, have named former SriLankan Airlines CEO Vipula Gunatilleka as the airline's Chief Financial Officer (CFO). Gunatilleka has been tasked with reviving the grounded carrier and will take on the role from March 1. He is reportedly considered as a "turnaround specialist" and was hired by SriLankan Airlines for its restructuring in 2018.

238.title: Worst experience: Lido employee takes to social media amid reports of shutdown
238.article_body: Amid reports of edtech startup Lido Learning shutting its operations, one of its employees shared a post to talk about his "worst experience" in the industry. Rishabh Kumar wrote, "The company closed its business...without...any notice to anyone...Suddenly on February 4...the founder announced the organisation has no funds...and they're shutting it down. They have no funds to credit salaries."

239.title: 19-yr-old kidnapped by 3 posing as Delhi police officers; rescued
239.article_body: A 19-year-old was rescued after three men, posing as Delhi Police officials kidnapped him, police said on Tuesday. "They told the victim that they had received a complaint against him and asked him to come with them to the Janakpuri police station," said Deputy Commissioner of Police (Southeast) Esha Pandey. Police have recovered ransom money and motorcycles from their possession.

240.title: Pics show interiors of Nawazuddin Siddiqui's newly built bungalow in Mumbai
240.article_body: Actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui has built a bungalow in Mumbai. Pictures show a view of the sitting area, a hall and the dining space in the house, which took three years to be completed. The structure is said to be inspired by his old house in his hometown and the house has been named 'Nawab', in the remembrance of his father.

241.title: Support Russian recognition of Ukraine's breakaway regions: Syria
241.article_body: Syrian Foreign Minister Faisal Mekdad said on Tuesday that country backs Russian recognition of two breakaway regions in eastern Ukraine, the self-proclaimed republics of Donetsk and Luhansk, and will "cooperate" with them. "What...West is doing against Russia is similar to what it did against Syria during...terrorist war," Mekdad added. Russia recognised the territories as independent on Monday.

242.title: Who better than him: Radhe Shyam director on Big B turning narrator for film
242.article_body: Director Radha Krishna Kumar, talking about actor Amitabh Bachchan turning narrator for Prabhas's film 'Radhe Shyam', said, "The film is set in 1970s...is mounted on...massive scale, we needed voice that can command nation and who better than Amitabh Bachchan." "A voice that everyone recognises, respects and more importantly loves. We are...happy to have him as Radhe Shyam's narrator," he added.

243.title: BJP, allies will form govt in UP with over 300 seats: Amit Shah
243.article_body: While addressing a rally in Uttar Pradesh's Raniganj, Union Home Minister Amit Shah said that BJP and its allies will form the government in UP with over 300 seats. "Where are Azam Khan, Ateeq Ahmed today? If you want them to remain in jail, you should vote for BJP," Shah said. BJP has brought an end to casteism, he added.

244.title: Those who migrated from UP to be called back if BSP wins: Mayawati
244.article_body: BSP chief Mayawati on Tuesday said those who have migrated from Uttar Pradesh will be called back and given jobs if the party comes to power in the state. At a rally, Mayawati alleged, "The Samajwadi Party, BJP and Congress never respected our great men nor did any good to the people of our society." Mayawati termed the BJP casteist.

245.title: New species of frog growing in freshwater found in Western Ghats
245.article_body: A new species of frog that grows in freshwater has been discovered by researchers at Zoological Survey of India, Pune. Named Euphlyctis jaladhara, the skittering frog species inhabits freshwater reserves of all states across Western Ghats. The features that make Jaladhara different from other skittering frogs are larger-sized female frogs, equal head size and colour patterns on the ventral side.

246.title: Russia will feel the pain: EU as it prepares sanctions over Ukraine
246.article_body: European Union ministers said they would agree on the first round of "tough" sanctions against Russia on Tuesday over Moscow's formal recognition of two breakaway regions in eastern Ukraine. "We have got to ensure that whatever happens, Russia will feel the pain...to make sure Russia has absolutely no incentive to go further," Irish EU affairs minister Thomas Byrne said.

247.title: Oil price hits highest level since 2014 amid Russia-Ukraine tensions
247.article_body: Crude oil price hit its highest level since 2014 on Tuesday pushing prices to near $100 per barrel as tensions between Russia and Ukraine escalated after Moscow ordered troops into two breakaway regions in eastern Ukraine. The global benchmark, Brent crude LCOc1, was up $3.48 at $98.87 at 09:00 GMT, having earlier reached $99.38, the highest since September 2014.

248.title: PMJJBY policyholders eligible for LIC IPO at discount: Chairman
248.article_body: Subscribers of Pradhan Mantri Jeevan Jyoti Bima Yojana (PMJJBY) are eligible for LIC's upcoming IPO at a discount, Chairman MR Kumar said. PMJJBY is a pure term insurance policy available to people in the age group of 18-50 years for a premium of ₹330 per annum per subscriber. The LIC IPO may reportedly open for subscription from March 10-14.

249.title: Virgin Hyperloop fires half its staff as it switches from passenger travel to freight
249.article_body: Virgin Hyperloop has laid off almost half of its employees as the company developing the high-speed mass transportation system pivots from passenger travel to freight. The company confirmed to Financial Times that 111 employees were laid off on Friday. Backed by billionaire Richard Branson’s Virgin Group, Virgin Hyperloop conducted the first-ever test of Hyperloop technology with humans in 2020.

250.title: Would love to debate with Narendra Modi on TV: Pakistan PM Imran Khan
250.article_body: Pakistani PM Imran Khan on Tuesday said that he would love to hold a TV debate with his Indian counterpart, Narendra Modi, to resolve differences between the two nations. Khan's comments come after his adviser on commerce Abdul Razak Dawood, backed the resumption of trade with India. Khan added, "India became a hostile country so trade with them became minimal."

251.title: I still remember every dance step: Jackky as 'Hero No 1' completes 25 yrs
251.article_body: Marking the 25th anniversary of 'Hero No 1', actor-producer Jackky Bhagnani shared a video on Instagram where he is seen rewatching the film with some people. "I still remember every moment of the film, the lyrics of every song, every dance step, which, as a child, I would try to imitate," he wrote. The film featured Govinda and Karisma Kapoor.

252.title: He's been picked on his potential: Dravid on Kishan ahead of SL T20I series
252.article_body: Talking about including Ishan Kishan in India's squad for T20I series against Sri Lanka, India head coach Rahul Dravid said he has been picked on his potential. The 23-year-old wicketkeeper-batter scored 35, 2 and 34 in first, second and third match respectively against West Indies in recently concluded T20I series. India-Sri Lanka first T20I will be played on Thursday.

253.title: Kohli told me 'You'd have to sacrifice 7 out of 10 things': Kishan on chat in IPL 2021
253.article_body: While talking about his aspirations, wicketkeeper-batter Ishan Kishan recalled his chat with Virat Kohli during IPL 2021 and said, "He told me, 'You would have to sacrifice seven out of 10 things'."  "I want to be as dedicated as Virat and Rohit Sharma are and emulate them. Earlier, I used to think, 'chalo cricket chal raha hai, everything is good'."

254.title: The ghosts Virat Kohli must be dealing with must be immense: Robin Uthappa
254.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli not scoring a hundred for over two years, CSK batter Robin Uthappa said, "For someone of his calibre to not score a hundred for [over two] years, the ghosts that he must be dealing with must be immense." He added, "These are very lonely battles that sportspersons go through."

255.title: Aayush Sharma dedicates his 1st award for 'Antim' to Salman Khan
255.article_body: Aayush Sharma bagged his first award for 'Antim: The Final Truth' at Dadasaheb Phalke International Film Festival Awards on Sunday. The actor won Best Actor in a Negative Role for portraying Rahul Dattaram Patil in the film. He dedicated the award to his brother-in-law and co-star Salman Khan. "I want to thank him for giving me this opportunity," said Aayush.

256.title: 'Growth' stocks like Meta, Apple, Amazon still not cheap: JP Morgan
256.article_body: Analysts at JP Morgan said that despite some sharp falls in the market over the last six months, tech-dominated "growth" stocks like Facebook (Meta), Apple, Amazon, Netflix and Google are "still not outright cheap". Talking about the Russia-Ukraine crisis, the analysts said it shouldn't drive a return to big tech names which were safe even during the COVID-19 pandemic.

257.title: Karnataka Assembly passes bill to hike salaries of lawmakers
257.article_body: The Karnataka Assembly has passed a bill that will increase the salaries of the Chief Minister, MLAs and MLCs up to 60% in the state. According to reports, the salary of CM will rise from ₹50,000 to ₹75,000, while that of the MLAs and MLCs will be hiked from ₹25,000 to ₹40,000. The ministers will earn ₹60,000, up from ₹40,000.

258.title: SpaceX launches 46 satellites days after geomagnetic storm hit 40
258.article_body: SpaceX on Monday launched 46 Starlink satellites using a two-stage Falcon 9 rocket, days after a geomagnetic storm hit 40 of its satellites. This was the 11th flight for the Falcon 9 first stage booster supporting this mission. Falcon 9's first stage came back down for the 100th Falcon 9 rocket landing for SpaceX.

259.title: MP CM names Kundalpur & Bandakpur as holy areas; bans meat, liquor
259.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Monday declared Kundalpur and Bandakpur, both in Damoh district, as holy areas. Meat and alcohol will be completely banned there, he added. Kundalpur is a historical pilgrimage site for Jains and Bandakpur is famous for a Lord Shiva temple. He said Jain monk Acharya Vidyasagar Ji Maharaj inspired him to take this decision.

260.title: Can't stop laughing: Zendaya as video of her tripping turns into viral meme
260.article_body: Zendaya shared memes made on a recent incident where she tripped and fell. Taking to Instagram Stories, she wrote, "I can't stop laughing. Did they really have to take...video of me tripping?" The video shows Zendaya getting out of her car and walking into a building escorted by security personnel. But as soon as she reaches the entrance, she trips.

261.title: SRK to start shooting for Hirani's film from April 15: Reports
261.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan will reportedly start shooting for Rajkumar Hirani's yet-untitled film from April 15. The first schedule will be shot in Mumbai's Film City Studios. According to reports, Shah Rukh will share screen space with Taapsee Pannu and Boman Irani in the upcoming social comedy. The makers are also in talks with Vicky Kaushal and Jim Sarbh for cameos.

262.title: I can't push anyone and say, 'Take me in your film': Tum Bin actor Priyanshu
262.article_body: Actor Priyanshu Chatterjee, who made his debut with film 'Tum Bin' said he isn't the kind of person who approaches people for work. He added, "It's out of my realm of things. I can't push anyone and say, 'Take me in your film'." "I'm very bad with PR...So whatever work comes my way, I pick out of that," he added.

263.title: Iran returns 8.2 lakh donated vaccines because they were made in US
263.article_body: Iran has returned 8.2 lakh AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine doses donated by Poland because they were manufactured in the US, Iran's state TV reported. Iran's Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei in 2020 banned imports of US and UK-made COVID-19 vaccines into the country, calling them "completely untrustworthy". Iran is currently witnessing the sixth wave of the pandemic, fuelled by the Omicron variant.

264.title: GB Nagar's 1st govt nursing college starts session with 48 students
264.article_body: The first government nursing college in Gautam Buddha Nagar began its first academic session with 48 students on Monday. The College Of Nursing was established by the Government Institute of Medical Sciences (GIMS) in Greater Noida. "The rest of the seats will be filled after the second round of counselling," Dr (Brig) Rakesh Gupta, Director of GIMS, said.

265.title: Annoyed with her engagement, UP man assaults woman, later dies by suicide
265.article_body: A man from Uttar Pradesh's Loni reportedly assaulted a 22-year-old woman and later died by suicide at his home on Monday. "My daughter's marriage was fixed. But one of the neighbours wanted to marry her. Annoyed at the engagement of my daughter, the boy...hit her on head...in Delhi when she was going to her office," the woman's father said.

266.title: Hyd Police auctions 600 seized & abandoned vehicles for over ₹51 lakh
266.article_body: The Hyderabad City Police on Tuesday conducted a public auction of around 600 seized and abandoned vehicles at Goshamahal police grounds. According to the police, about 550 bidders, who were mostly from the automobile field, attended the auction event. "The total amount received in the auction out of the sale of 600 vehicles is ₹51,74,000," the police informed on Facebook.

267.title: DMK conducted urban polls shamefully, will move HC: BJP's TN chief
267.article_body: Tamil Nadu BJP chief K Annamalai on Tuesday criticised the ruling DMK, saying it conducted the urban local body polls in a shameful manner. "People didn't...vote, fearing DMK fellows," he said. He claimed Union Minister L Murugan's vote was cast by someone else and he was allowed to vote after a protest. "BJP is moving...Madras HC today," he added.

268.title: Man who married 27 women saved their names as 'Madam Delhi', 'Madam UP' on phone
268.article_body: Police have gone through the phone records of Bibhu Prakash Swain from Odisha who's accused of cheating at least 27 women into marrying him by pretending to be a doctor. They found that Swain had saved his wives' contacts as 'Madam Delhi', 'Madam Assam' or 'Madam UP' to indicate the places where they stayed. He was arrested recently.

269.title: Used to practice Tobey's Spider-Man lines when I was high: Andrew
269.article_body: Actor Andrew Garfield revealed in an interview that when he was in drama school, he used to practice lines from Tobey Maguire's 'Spider-Man' films in the mirror. "I was very high at the time," the actor added. Andrew further said that his friend used to laugh at him practicing the lines and would joke that he would never play Spider-Man.

270.title: I'm looking to face Bumrah in the nets: MI's ₹8.25 crore buy Tim David
270.article_body: All-rounder Tim David, who was bought by MI for ₹8.25 crore at the IPL mega auction, has said he's looking to face Jasprit Bumrah in the nets during the T20 tournament. "Because he's one of the best in the world...[and] I believe it'll be great to test myself against him. I'm sure it's going to be hard work," David added.

271.title: No threat to NDA even if Shiv Sena & others form 3rd front: Athawale
271.article_body: Union Minister Ramdas Athawale has said that there's no threat to National Democratic Alliance (NDA) even if Shiv Sena and other parties come together to form an anti-BJP front for 2024 Lok Sabha elections. His comments came after Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao met his Maharashtra counterpart on Sunday to discuss the formation of an Opposition alliance to oppose BJP.

272.title: China warns its nationals in Ukraine amid 'worsening' situation
272.article_body: Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi said on Tuesday that the country is concerned about the "worsening" situation in Ukraine. China's embassy in Ukraine has also warned its nationals against venturing out in unstable areas. Yi's remarks come after Russia decided to move its troops into two breakaway regions in eastern Ukraine, which Russia recognised as independent on Monday.

273.title: I gave evidence to police against son: Father of Mumbai man who killed his girlfriend
273.article_body: After police arrested a 27-year-old man for allegedly killing his 29-year-old girlfriend in Mumbai, his father said he gave evidence against his son to police. "If you realise, we got our own child arrested," he added, stating that they called police to collect footage of CCTV camera outside their house. Police said the victim was pressurising him to marry her.

274.title: Govt is not very fond of art and culture, I don't see upliftment: Amaan Ali
274.article_body: Musician Amaan Ali said the "government is not very fond of art and culture". "Government of our country should promote live shows...the chain of no live shows has to break...People from the entertainment industry have always given their best to make people happy. Now, they should also be supported," he said, adding, "I don't see upliftment of art and culture."

275.title: BJP in politics to build nation, not just form govts: Rajnath Singh
275.article_body: Union Minister and BJP leader Rajnath Singh on Tuesday said the BJP is "in politics not just to form governments but to build society and the country". BJP has erased the issue of unreliability of politicians, he added. "Many parties have been formed and have become extinct over the years," he said at a rally in Sikanderpur.

276.title: BJP deceiving sanitation workers for past 30 yrs in Delhi: AAP's Durgesh Pathak
276.article_body: AAP leader Durgesh Pathak said that the BJP has been deceiving sanitation workers for around past 30 years in Delhi. His remark came after Delhi BJP chief Adesh Gupta announced that BJP-ruled MCDs will regularise 16,346 sanitation workers. "Many sanitation workers called me and said BJP has made these promises many times but never fulfilled them," Pathak added.

277.title: Elephants Laxmi Prasad and Hari Prasad to chase off rhinos in Assam's Majuli
277.article_body: The Forest Department in Assam's Majuli has deployed two elephants - Laxmi Prasad and Hari Prasad - to chase off rhinoceros who have created a ruckus in the rural areas since last month. "The rhinoceros were [earlier] chased away on February 20. Now, they have come to the village again. So we have called the elephants [again]," said an official.

278.title: 3 including couple held for killing female police officer in UP
278.article_body: Three people, including a husband and his wife, were arrested on Monday for allegedly murdering a female police officer in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow. During interrogation, the accused husband admitted to having an extramarital affair with the deceased, a police officer said. The accused couple decided to eliminate the deceased after she pressured the husband for marriage, the police officer added.

279.title: Startup Lido Learning, backed by Ronnie Screwvala, shuts operations: Report
279.article_body: Edtech startup Lido Learning, backed by entrepreneur Ronnie Screwvala, Shaadi.com's Anupam Mittal, among others, has apparently shut operations. As per employees, Lido Learning's Founder Sahil Sheth informed them that the startup is going through financial constraints. Founded in 2019, the startup had raised $10 million in September last year in a round led by Screwvala's Unilazer Ventures.

280.title: Man attacks woman for rejecting marriage proposal in UP, dies by suicide
280.article_body: A 25-year-old man died by suicide in UP's Ghaziabad after he allegedly attacked a woman with a hammer for rejecting his marriage proposal, police said. The man attacked her when she was going to her office on Monday, police added. The woman's father told the police that the man was angry after he had fixed the marriage of her daughter.

281.title: WB CM orders SIT probe into student leader's death after protests
281.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Monday formed a Special Investigation Team (SIT) to investigate the death of a 28-year-old student leader following protests. The deceased's family has alleged that Anis Khan was thrown off the roof of his residence in Howrah by four persons, including one who was dressed as a police officer. The police have denied the allegation.

282.title: Berlin audience clapped for 6-7 mins nonstop: Bhansali on Gangubai Kathiawadi
282.article_body: Speaking about the screening of 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' at the Berlin Film Festival, director Sanjay Leela Bhansali said it gave him confidence for its Indian release. He added, "When I heard...standing ovation in Berlin I got my answer." "They...clapped for 6-7 minutes nonstop. That isn't a small thing. It made all the pain and effort worth the while," Bhansali said.

283.title: Plea seeks common syllabus for kids across India, HC asks Centre to reply
283.article_body: The Delhi High Court has asked the Centre to reply to a plea seeking a common syllabus and curriculum for children across the country. The petition said that the absence of a common curriculum in mother language leads to fostering and perpetuation of ignorance. The present system doesn't provide equal opportunity to all children, it added.

284.title: Downey Jr to reunite with 'Iron Man 3' director for a film: Reports
284.article_body: Robert Downey Jr will reportedly reunite with 'Iron Man 3' director Shane Black for a film based on the crime fiction novel series 'The Parker', penned by Donald E Westlake. Parker, a professional thief, is the main protagonist of 24 of the 28 novels Westlake wrote under the pseudonym Richard Stark. The film adaptation is being developed by Amazon Studios.

285.title: Vote for BJP if you want Azam Khan, Atiq to remain in jail: Amit Shah in UP
285.article_body: The BJP has brought an end to casteism and dynastic politics, Union Home Minister Amit Shah said. "Where are Azam Khan, Atiq Ahmad today? If you want them to remain in jail, you should vote for BJP," Shah said while addressing a rally in Raniganj. "With 300 seats, BJP along with its allies will form government in UP," Shah added.

286.title: Vedantu looks to expand globally as it prepares for IPO in 2023-24
286.article_body: Edtech unicorn Vedantu is planning to expand to the global market as it prepares for an initial public offering (IPO) in 2023-24, Co-founder Vamsi Krishna told VCCircle. Vedantu will launch operations in West Asia by June. It plans to list within the next 18-24 months. Vedantu turned into a unicorn last year after raising $100 million.

287.title: 75% of people worldwide want single-use plastics banned: Global Survey
287.article_body: According to a global survey by IPSOS that covered more than 20,00 people across 28 countries, 75% of them want single-use plastics to be banned. Moreover, 82% of them said they favoured products with much less plastic packaging. The poll was released on Tuesday as United Nations members plan to bring a global treaty to contain plastic pollution.

288.title: 18-year-old stabbed by classmate in Haryana's Rewari, critical
288.article_body: An 18-year-old student was on Monday allegedly stabbed by his classmate at Government Senior Secondary School, Bawal, in Haryana's Rewari. The victim was attending class when the accused, identified as Pankaj Kumar, and his unidentified aide attacked him. "The victim's condition is...critical. Both students had quarrelled with each other a few days ago," a police spokesperson said.

289.title: Can't compare profits of insurers with manufacturing firms: LIC Chairman
289.article_body: LIC Chairman MR Kumar said that profits of insurance companies cannot be compared with manufacturing companies as dynamics of the businesses are "different". IPO-bound LIC has generated over ₹50,000 crore surplus in the past two years, out of which 95% goes to policyholder, he added. The remaining 5% may appear small but then it is not so, he further said.

290.title: SC asks Maha govt to hold probe against ex-Mumbai Police chief Param Bir
290.article_body: Supreme Court has directed the Maharashtra government to hold the investigation against former Mumbai Police Commissioner Param Bir Singh over allegations of misconduct and corruption. "We have now put down the matter for final hearing, investigation being completed can pose problems," SC said. "We have had occasion to say earlier that it is a messy state of affairs," SC added.

291.title: Inappropriate to compare 2 states: Vijayan on Yogi's Kerala remark
291.article_body: Talking about Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath's remark, his Kerala counterpart Pinarayi Vijayan on Tuesday said it was not appropriate for a CM to compare two states. "Kerala is far ahead in various sectors. His [Adityanath] comment can be viewed only as...one made with political interests," Vijayan said. Adityanath had said UP could become Kerala if voters commit any mistake.

292.title: Man robbed of over ₹11 lakh by 3 bike-borne men in Delhi; probe on
292.article_body: An investigation has been launched after a man was allegedly robbed of more than ₹11 lakh by three bike-borne men in Delhi, police said on Tuesday. The incident took place on Monday under the Punjabi Bagh underpass on Rohtak Road. The victim, who reportedly works for a mobile recharge dealer based in Delhi's Rampura, had collected cash from different locations.

293.title: Alia quotes Bhagavad Gita after Kangana's remark before 'Gangubai...' release
293.article_body: Asked to comment on Kangana Ranaut's Instagram post wherein she seemingly criticised Alia Bhatt and said, "This Friday ₹200 crore will be burnt to ashes at...box office" ahead of 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' release, Alia quoted the Bhagavad Gita. "Lord Krishna had said...inaction is in action. That's all I want to say," she stated. Kangana also seemingly called Alia a "romcom bimbo".

294.title: 855 bottles of banned cough syrup seized at Ind-B'desh border; 1 held
294.article_body: Border Security Force (BSF) troopers from South Bengal Frontiers arrested a Bangladeshi national at the India-Bangladesh border on Tuesday. They recovered 855 bottles of banned cough syrup Phensedyl from him. The accused, who was involved in narcotics smuggling in the region for the past few days, was smuggling these bottles to Bangladesh, police said.

295.title: 5 more arrested for murder of matka businessman in Pune
295.article_body: The police have arrested five more persons for their alleged role in the murder of 36-year-old Matka (gambling) businessman, Sanjay Patole from Pune, taking the total arrests to seven. Police said that a hotel bill found in the deceased's pocket provided a "crucial lead". We checked the hotel's CCTV cameras and zeroed in on people seen with Patole, police said.

296.title: China & Russia arming Myanmar military: UN expert amid violence
296.article_body: China and Russia are among those arming Myanmar's military junta, a UN rights expert said. "Despite...evidence of the military junta's atrocity crimes being committed with impunity since launching a coup last year...Russia and China continue to provide...Myanmar military junta with...fighter jets, armoured vehicles," Thomas Andrews said. Serbia has also been supplying weapons to Myanmar, he added.

297.title: I gave evidence to police against son: Father of Mumbai man who killed his girlfriend
297.article_body: After police arrested a 27-year-old man for allegedly killing his 29-year-old girlfriend in Mumbai, his father said he gave evidence against his son to police. "If you realise, we got our own child arrested," he added, stating that they called police to collect footage of CCTV camera outside their house. Police said the victim was pressurising him to marry her.

298.title: Cong never worked for Manipur's development in decades: PM Modi
298.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday said Congress never worked for the development of Manipur despite ruling the state for decades. "The Congress party could never understand the feelings of the people of the North East," PM Modi said. "Manipur will become an important centre for East Asia connectivity after the highway connecting Myanmar-Thailand is completed," he added.

299.title: Cong behind Bajrang Dal activist Harsha's killing: K'taka BJP MLA
299.article_body: BJP MLA MP Renukacharya on Tuesday said Congress was behind the alleged murder of Bajrang Dal activist Harsha and urged the government to hand over the case to the National Investigation Agency. "The police failed to give security to Harsha," he said. The 26-year-old Bajrang Dal activist was allegedly murdered on Monday in Karnataka's Shivamogga.

300.title: ICCR to hold 3-day Indian crafts fair in Delhi from February 23
300.article_body: The Indian Council for Cultural Relations (ICCR) is organising a three-day crafts exhibition-cum-fair at Bikaner House in Delhi from February 23-25. Artists and craftspeople from 11 states will showcase traditional art and craft forms in the fair, which is named "Coalescence: Craft-Culture-Community-Climate". The programme is being celebrated as part of the 'Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav' celebrations.

301.title: It's my red lipstick: Urvashi criticises news report for spotting 'love bite' on her
301.article_body: Actress Urvashi Rautela took to Twitter to criticise a news report that claimed a love bite was spotted on her neck during an airport visit. Demanding an apology, Rautela tweeted, "Ridiculous! It's my red lipstick which spread from my mask. It's hard to maintain red lips ask any girl. Why don't you...write about my achievements than spreading fake news".

302.title: Blackmailers circulating same complaints for 3 years: Indiabulls after ED searches
302.article_body: After the ED searched its premises in Mumbai, Indiabulls Housing Finance said that ED's case report was based on an FIR filed by Ashutosh Kamble, who's part of "the long-running extortion racket" against it. "The FIR is a copy-and-paste of earlier several patently false...and malicious complaints that blackmailers have been circulating for three years now," the company added.

303.title: Hindus who don't vote for me have Muslim blood: BJP MLA
303.article_body: BJP MLA from Uttar Pradesh's Domariyaganj Raghvendra Pratap Singh said that Hindus who will not vote for him in the Assembly elections have "Muslim blood in their veins". Later, Singh said, "I have said those things...But I had spoken in another context, as an example, and was making a comparison with the past. I had no intention to threaten anybody."

304.title: Russian invasion of Ukraine has begun: UK
304.article_body: After Russian President Vladimir Putin ordered the deployment of troops to two breakaway regions in eastern Ukraine, UK Health Secretary Sajid Javid said, "You can conclude that the invasion of Ukraine has begun." "The Russians, President Putin, [have] decided to attack the sovereignty of Ukraine and its territorial integrity," he further said, calling it a "dark day in Europe".

305.title: I am afraid that I will get bored as an actor: Shahid Kapoor
305.article_body: Shahid Kapoor admitted he is "afraid" of getting bored as an actor and doing his roles like a daily job. "I have done films for 18-19 years. As an actor you should...do what you strongly feel about," said Shahid. "It's so hypocritical to discriminate between what you do and what you like to watch," added Shahid.

306.title: Into the adulthood of our married lives: Raveena to husband on 18th anniversary
306.article_body: Actress Raveena Tandon, on Tuesday, took to Instagram to celebrate her 18th wedding anniversary with husband and film distributor Anil Thadani. Sharing a few pictures and videos from their wedding ceremony, Raveena wrote, "As we get into the adulthood of our married lives, 18 years today, I couldn't have asked for anything more than you. Through our...thick and thin."

307.title: John announces new film 'Tehran', to clash with Hrithik's 'Fighter'
307.article_body: John Abraham on Tuesday announced his new film, titled 'Tehran'. The actor shared that the "action-packed" film will release in theatres on January 26, 2023. The film, which is said to be based on true events, is set to clash with Hrithik Roshan and Deepika Padukone's 'Fighter' at the box office. Directed by Siddharth Anand, 'Fighter' also stars Anil Kapoor.

308.title: 3 killed, 4 injured as car overturns in attempt to save cow in Rajasthan
308.article_body: Three people, including a woman, died and four others sustained injuries when the car they were travelling in overturned in an attempt to save a cow in Rajasthan's Jaisalmer district on Tuesday, a police officer said. The incident took place near Khetolai village under the Lathi police station area. The injured persons were admitted to the Pokaran Hospital, police added.

309.title: 45-yr-old rapes & impregnates 16-yr-old in Navi Mumbai, arrested
309.article_body: A 45-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly raping and impregnating a 16-year-old girl in Navi Mumbai. The victim's family learned about the pregnancy in the ninth month. The abuse had started in 2020 and the accused allegedly gave her contraceptive pills after raping her, police said. The accused also clicked compromising pictures of the victim and allegedly blackmailed her.

310.title: 4-year-old boy shoots policeman on father's order in US
310.article_body: A four-year-old boy sitting close to his three-year-old sibling reportedly shot and injured a policeman after his father asked him to do so in US' Utah. The incident occurred when the man was being arrested following a complaint by a fast-food restaurant. According to authorities, the officer who tried to deflect the pistol got shot in the arm.

311.title: Worrying part was my rising price, my heart skipped a beat: MI's ₹15.25-cr buy Kishan
311.article_body: Ishan Kishan, who was bought by MI for ₹15.25 crore in IPL mega auction, said he was worried when his price rose as he knew MI also needed to save money to build rest of the squad. "It wasn't just about me. For a minute there, I must admit, my heart skipped a beat," the 23-year-old wicket-keeper-batter added.

312.title: Mumbai court acquits driver for accident that killed 6-yr-old, blames parents
312.article_body: A court recently acquitted a driver who was booked after his car knocked down a six-year-old boy to death in Mumbai in 2018. The child was crossing the road when the accident happened. The court said his parents should've prevented him from going near the road. "He was crossing road it means that...care wasn't taken by their parents," it added.

313.title: Tanya went through pain, took care of me during ups and downs: Bobby on wife
313.article_body: Actor Bobby Deol said that his wife Tanya Deol is his strength and is the "best thing ever happened" to him. "I went through bad phase, I went through ups and downs and she took care of me. She went through all my pain," he said, adding that one day, he realised he had to get over his self pity.

314.title: Putin put Orwell to shame; no limits to dictator's imagination: Lithuania PM
314.article_body: Lithuanian PM Ingrida Šimonytė said that Russian President Vladimir Putin's move to recognise two breakaway regions in Ukraine as independent puts "Kafka and Orwell to shame". "No limits to dictator's imagination, no lows too low, no lies too blatant, no red lines too red to cross," she tweeted. Both Franz Kafka and George Orwell wrote novels about an authoritarian state.

315.title: Australia to spend over ₹4,300 crore for research, surveillance in Antarctica
315.article_body: Australia has pledged to invest A$804 million (over ₹4,300 crore) for research and surveillance in Antarctica. The fund will be used to buy drones and helicopters and for building mobile stations, said Australian PM Scott Morrison. "It will enable us to explore areas of East Antarctica's inland that no country has ever been able to reach before," he added.

316.title: Australia shuts its embassy in Ukraine amid Russia invasion threat
316.article_body: Australia on Tuesday announced that it has temporarily closed its embassy in Ukraine amid a threat of invasion from Russia. Australian Embassy staff have also been directed to leave Ukraine. Notably, this comes after Russia's President Vladimir Putin's move to recognise two breakaway Ukrainian regions as independent and deployment of Russian troops into these areas.

317.title: Suryakumar is India's 360-degree player like De Villiers: Parthiv
317.article_body: Terming Suryakumar Yadav's 31-ball 65 in India's third T20I against West Indies as a knock which "didn't come" under easy conditions, Parthiv Patel said Suryakumar is India's 360-degree player like AB de Villiers. "It was a sticky wicket. Rohit Sharma didn't manage to score runs but Suryakumar started well and stayed till the end," added Parthiv.

318.title: Alibaba leads China tech stocks drop amid regulatory action fear
318.article_body: Alibaba led the decline in Chinese technology stocks following a Bloomberg report that authorities have begun another round of checks on its fintech business arm. The tech stocks have been dropping amid worries over Beijing's regulatory plans for the sector. The Hang Seng Tech Index fell over 3% on Tuesday, heading for the lowest close since its inception in 2020.

319.title: SPPU traffic diversion to stay till completion of flyover: Pune Police
319.article_body: Pune Police said that the traffic diversion at SPPU chowk will stay till the completion of an integrated multilevel flyover. The vehicles now have to stop only for 30 seconds as opposed to the earlier 170 seconds, police added. "It's true some commuters have to take a long route because of the one way but...it's relatively less distressing," police stated.

320.title: BJP talks about terrorism but won’t address terror of unemployment: Priyanka
320.article_body: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra said that the BJP talks about "Pakistan and terrorism" but it won't talk about the "terror" of unemployment and inflation. "What benefit has BJP government given in last five years? People don't have money for food and they (BJP) divert our minds towards religion and Pakistan," Priyanka added.

321.title: Batters played to their strengths: Sophie on NZ's 4th ODI win vs India
321.article_body: Following New Zealand Women's 63-run win in fourth ODI of five-match series against India Women, New Zealand skipper Sophie Devine said it was another complete performance from her side, adding the batters played to their strengths. Fourth ODI was curtailed to 20-overs per side due to rain in Queenstown. The hosts bowled out the visitors for 128 in 17.5 overs.

322.title: Bowling is a bit of a concern before WC: Mithali after 4th straight ODI loss to NZ
322.article_body: India Women captain Mithali Raj expressed disappointment after suffering their fourth straight ODI defeat on their tour of New Zealand. "We've been trying a few compositions with our [bowling] attack. But...[it's] a bit of concern before the World Cup," she stated. The 2022 ICC Women's ODI World Cup will take place in New Zealand between March 4 and April 3.

323.title: Dhoni, Rohit should be the captains in IPL All-Star match: Harbhajan
323.article_body: Responding to a tweet by Mumbai Indians' official Twitter handle over the two captains in an IPL All-Star match, Harbhajan Singh named MS Dhoni and Rohit Sharma. CSK have won the IPL four times under MS Dhoni's captaincy, with IPL 2021 their most recent triumph. MI won the IPL for a record-extending fifth time in IPL 2020 under Rohit Sharma.

324.title: Delhi man killed as duo beat him with stones for resisting robbery bid
324.article_body: A 32-year-old man was allegedly killed by two men, aged 22 and 23 years, for resisting a robbery attempt in Delhi's Karol Bagh area. The deceased was going to his home on Saturday when the accused attacked him, beat him with stones multiple times and fled with his bag and phone. Meanwhile, police have arrested the accused persons on Monday.

325.title: French man blocks town’s internet while trying to cut kids’ screen time
325.article_body: A man, in an attempt to block internet access for his children, accidentally disrupted the entire town's internet service in France. He had purchased a jammer to block the connection in his house to prevent his children from scrolling social media at midnight. He now faces up to six months of jail and a €30,000 (around ₹25 lakh) fine.

326.title: I found those jokes funny: Rannvijay on his viral Shark Tank India memes
326.article_body: 'Shark Tank India' host Rannvijay Singha said that he found the memes and jokes made on him "funny". He added, "When a meme is made on you it means you're doing something which is getting noticed." "I've done...Roadies and by now I'm used to memes...I love watching the amount of creativity...people put in while creating these memes," Rannvijay said.

327.title: Esha Deol joins Suniel Shetty's debut OTT show 'Invisible Woman'
327.article_body: Esha Deol has bagged a role in Suniel Shetty's debut web show 'Invisible Woman'. "A project like this is truly fantastic...The story has mystery and great scope for histrionics," she said about the upcoming show. Esha, who has previously worked with Suniel in films like 'Cash' and 'LOC: Kargil', added, "To work with Suniel Anna again is an absolute delight."

328.title: PM Modi may visit Pune ahead of civic body elections: PMC Mayor
328.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) Mayor Murlidhar Mohol has said that PM Narendra Modi may visit the city in early March, ahead of the upcoming civic body polls. Mohol said that PM Modi may inaugurate infrastructure projects, including a riverfront beautification plan, during his visit. PM Modi "is [also] likely to inaugurate a few routes of...Pune Metro rail", Mohol added.

329.title: Midday meals in schools only after 100% attendance: Delhi govt responds to legal notice
329.article_body: The Delhi government has said that doorstep delivery of dry ration kits will continue instead of hot cooked midday meals till 100% attendance is achieved in the government schools. This comes after Delhi Rozi Roti Adhikar Abhiyan (DRRAA), an organisation working on food rights, sent a legal notice to the Delhi government and three municipal corporations in the national capital.

330.title: It was a nightmare: Naagin fame Ankit as airlines company misplaces his luggage
330.article_body: Naagin actor Ankit Bathla recently shared about a "nightmare" situation he faced while travelling from Delhi to Bengaluru. Ankit said that after he landed in Bengaluru, he kept waiting for his luggage at the baggage belt, but it didn't arrive. "I was stranded without any clothes when a trip I was making was already very time-limited," Ankit said.

331.title: Hope I get to dance next to Madhuri, it'd be an honour: Sharvari
331.article_body: Actress Sharvari Wagh, who made her Bollywood debut with 'Bunty Aur Babli 2', has said that she hopes she gets to dance next to actress Madhuri Dixit someday. "She's been my idol...It would be an honour," she added. Sharvari further said she has been Googling Kathak teachers to start learning the dance form after watching Madhuri's songs and Instagram videos.

332.title: Turkey 'strongly advises' citizens to leave eastern Ukraine
332.article_body: Turkey's Foreign Ministry on Tuesday "strongly advised" Turkish citizens to leave eastern Ukraine after Russia recognised two regions in eastern Ukraine as independent entities. NATO member Turkey, which shares a maritime border with Russia and Ukraine in the Black Sea, has called for a peaceful solution to the ongoing crisis. Turkey has also offered to mediate talks between them.

333.title: Man named Salman Khan stands near Goa-Mumbai flight's door after takeoff, creates ruckus
333.article_body: A 26-year-old businessman, Salman Khan, from Delhi was arrested for allegedly creating a ruckus on a Goa-Mumbai flight after he came near the galley of the flight's door with his bag soon after takeoff. A flight attendant said that he kept insisting on meeting the pilot. Khan was forcibly made to sit by passengers so that the flight could land.

334.title: Sirona acquires women's safety brand Impower in an all-cash deal
334.article_body: Sirona Hygiene has acquired women's safety brand Impower in an all-cash deal, however, the financial details of the deal have not been disclosed. Sirona Co-founder Deep Bajaj has said it will invest ₹30 crore in Impower over the next two years. Earlier, The Good Glamm Group had acquired a controlling stake in Sirona in an all-cash deal worth ₹100 crore.

335.title: Urfi Javed accuses casting director of seeking sexual favours from girls, shares chats
335.article_body: Bigg Boss OTT contestant Urfi Javed accused casting director Obed Afridi of seeking sexual favours from young girls. Urfi had uploaded screenshots of her conversation with Obed following his refusal to pay her for her job. Many models began replying to Urfi, implying he had requested sexual favours. She shared screenshots of girls who contacted her and shared their experiences.

336.title: Man finds 26.11-carat diamond worth ₹1.2 crore in mine in MP's Panna
336.article_body: A small-scale brick kiln operator in MP's Panna district found a 26.11-carat diamond in a shallow mine, an official said on Tuesday. The precious stone may fetch up to ₹ 1.20 crore in an auction, Panna's diamond officer Ravi Patel has said. The proceeds of the upcoming auction will go to the miner after deduction of government royalty and taxes.

337.title: Comedian Munawar Faruqui announced as 2nd contestant on 'Lock Upp'
337.article_body: Comedian Munawar Faruqui has been announced as the second contestant of Kangana Ranaut's reality television show 'Lock Upp: Badass Jail, Atyaachaari Khel'. The charge against Munawar in the promo video is 'joke gone wrong'. The comedian had earlier spent a month in jail after being charged with insulting Hindu gods and goddesses during one of his shows.

338.title: NCP's Supriya Sule among 11 MPs to get Sansad Ratna Award 2022
338.article_body: NCP leader Supriya Sule is among the 11 MPs who will be given the Sansad Ratna Award 2022. The awardees include eight MPs from the Lok Sabha and three from the Rajya Sabha, the Prime Point Foundation said. Congress' veteran leader M Veerappa Moily and BJP leader from Tamil Nadu HV Hande have been nominated for a lifetime achievement award.

339.title: Shoaib Akhtar bowled the fastest ball in cricket history at 2003 World Cup
339.article_body: Pakistan's Shoaib Akhtar bowled the fastest delivery in recorded history after clocking 161.3kmph on February 22, 2003, at the World Cup. The delivery helped Akhtar complete a maiden over against England's Nick Knight, with first five balls having speeds of 153.3kmph, 158.4kmph, 158.5kmph, 157.4kmph and 159.5kmph. Later, Akhtar gave Knight an autographed limited edition photograph of the ball.

340.title: Ashneer files arbitration plea, calls BharatPe investigation against him illegal: Reports
340.article_body: BharatPe Co-founder Ashneer Grover filed an arbitration plea in the Singapore International Arbitration Centre claiming that BharatPe's investigation against him is illegal, ET and Livemint reported. He claims BharatPe kept the investigation opaque and gave him no chance to present his case. Grover also sought indemnity from any future action against him in his settlement talks with BharatPe.

341.title: Never once has it crossed my mind that I want Pant's place: Ishan Kishan
341.article_body: Talking about his friendship with wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant, Ishan Kishan said they never think about competing with each other for a place in the team. "I speak my mind with Pant...Never once has it crossed my mind that I want his place," Ishan stated. "I love wicket-keeping so whenever an opportunity comes...I'll try and give it my best," he added.

342.title: Swiggy preparing for $800 million IPO early next year: Report
342.article_body: Swiggy has started preparations to raise at least $800 million through an IPO early next year, the Nikkei reported. The food and grocery delivery platform reportedly plans to position itself as a logistics company and has begun adding independent directors to the board. Notably, Swiggy raised $700 million last month, reportedly doubling its valuation to $10.7 billion in six months.

343.title: 2 booked for beating bull with sticks for damaging crops in MP
343.article_body: A case was filed against a woman and her grandson after they allegedly beat a bull with sticks when it entered the field and damaged crops in Madhya Pradesh's Lasudia, police said on Monday. The accused were booked under the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals Act, an official said. A video of the incident had gone viral, the official added.

344.title: Newlywed couple attacked by woman's brothers for eloping in Pune
344.article_body: A couple who got married after eloping from Satara was allegedly attacked by the woman's brothers in Pune's Pimpri Chinchwad. The accused reportedly forced the couple's rickshaw to stop and then attacked them with sharp weapons on the head. "We have given a notice to the accused to appear at the police station," a senior inspector said.

345.title: Kili Paul, who lip-syncs Indian songs, honoured by Indian embassy in Tanzania
345.article_body: The Indian High Commission in Tanzania honoured Kili Paul, who lip-syncs popular songs from Indian movies, on Monday. "Famous Tanzanian artist Kili Paul has won millions of hearts in India," High Commissioner of India in Tanzania, Binaya Pradhan, wrote while sharing pictures on Twitter. Pradhan described Kili Paul as a "special visitor".

346.title: Vedant Fashions shares fall below IPO price for 1st time since listing
346.article_body: Ethnic wear brand Manyavar's owner Vedant Fashions' shares fell below the IPO price for the first time since its listing on Tuesday. The stock listed at ₹936 on February 16 with gains of 8% from its issue price of ₹866 per share. The stock had hit a high of ₹993 on listing day and has declined nearly 16% since then.

347.title: Air India flight gets water salute in Maldives for 46 yrs of air service
347.article_body: Air India on Monday shared a video of one of its flights receiving a water cannon salute on landing at Male airport in Maldives.
