The aircraft was welcomed to commemorate 46 years of air service between India and the Maldives. The airlines mentioned that the first flight between the two countries was operated from Thiruvananthapuram to Male in February 1976.

348.title: I-PAC abandoned party candidates after Assembly polls: TMC Goa chief
348.article_body: Goa TMC chief Kiran Kandolkar has claimed that Prashant Kishor's I-PAC which was TMC's political consultant abandoned the party candidates after the state Assembly polls. "All candidates fielded by the TMC have some or the other issues with the I-PAC...I discussed the matter with my party workers, who advised me to quit as the TMC Goa president," he said.

349.title: Internet restored in Tonga 5 weeks after volcanic eruption
349.article_body: Internet connection was restored in Tonga on Tuesday following repairs to an undersea cable, five weeks after a volcanic eruption cut communications to the remote Pacific island nation. The volcanic eruption that took place on January 15, triggered a tsunami that reached as far as Alaska, Japan, and South America. Around 85% of Tonga's population was affected by the disaster.

350.title: Lived with mental illness, was conscious of portrayal: Deepika on 'Gehraiyaan'
350.article_body: Actress Deepika Padukone said that having lived with mental illness, she was conscious about how it was portrayed in 'Gehraiyaan'. "But it's not like the film is about that. It's one of the threads. In fact, it's not even a thread, it's backstory, or something that this character is dealing with. But there's so much else going on," she added.

351.title: Our work in last 5 yrs laid foundation for next 25 yrs: PM in Manipur
351.article_body: In the last five years, BJP's double engine government worked towards the overall development of Manipur, PM Narendra Modi said on Tuesday while addressing a rally in the state. "You have seen BJP's good governance and good intentions. Our work in the last five years has laid the foundation for the next 25 years," PM Modi added.

352.title: Chandigarh faces power outage in many parts as electricity dept staff go on strike
352.article_body: A major power outage was reported in parts of Chandigarh as employees of the electricity department went on a three-day strike against privatisation. The employees have reportedly threatened to extend the protest indefinitely if the move isn't halted. The administration told the Municipal Corporation to arrange alternative sources of power supply and seek Haryana and Punjab's aid for manpower.

353.title: Maharashtra govt culls over 25,000 birds amid bird flu scare
353.article_body: Days after bird flu cases were detected in Maharashtra's Thane and Palghar districts, the state decided to kill over 25,000 birds. "The decision of killing over 25,000 birds in 1 km radius of infection hotspots in both districts was taken. The labourers working in farms have also been isolated," said state's Animal Husbandry Minister Sunil Kedar.

354.title: Eve-teasers stabbed to death by woman's brothers in Karnataka
354.article_body: Two people, Salem and Abdulla, were stabbed to death in Karnataka's Shivamogga by a girl's brothers, Dadapeer and Tippu, for allegedly misbehaving with her. Police said that Salem and Abdulla had come on a bike and allegedly misbehaved with their sister. An officer said that Dadapeer called his friend Allabhaksh and others to thrash them, which resulted in the murder.

355.title: All accused in Bajrang Dal activist murder case identified: Karnataka ADGP
355.article_body: All the accused in Bajrang Dal activist murder case have been identified, Karnataka's Additional Director General of Police Pratap Reddy said. "Work is going on and we are on the verge of completing the detection and arresting the accused persons," Reddy added. This comes after a 26-year-old Bajrang Dal activist named Harsha was allegedly murdered in Karnataka's Shivamogga on Sunday.

356.title: I did prepare you: Karan to Shakun on polarising reactions for Gehraiyaan
356.article_body: Producer Karan Johar said that he tried to prepare director Shakun Batra for the polarising response that he was sure that Gehraiyaan would attract. "Karan and I...knew there were going to be opinions," Shakun added. "[Karan] did say, this can be polarised...He's somebody who's seen films release over decades, he has...more sense of how the audience can react," Shakun said.

357.title: Before whiskey started showing up on belly: Anurag shares pic from college days
357.article_body: Filmmaker Anurag Kashyap took to Instagram and shared a throwback picture from his college days. "Before the whiskey started showing up on the belly...circa 1991," he wrote with the hashtags 'Hansraj College' and 'hostel life'. Anil Kapoor, who worked with the filmmaker in 'AK vs AK', reacted to his post, writing, "Is this really you Mr Anurag Kashyap?"

358.title: Fleet management startup Fleetx raises ₹145 cr led by IndiaMart
358.article_body: Gurugram-based fleet management platform Fleetx.io has raised over ₹145 crore in IndiaMart-led funding. Others who participated in the round include India Quotient and BEENEXT. Founded by Vineet Sharma, Abhay Jeet Gupta, Udbhav Rai, Parveen Kataria and Vishal Misra, Fleetx provides IoT and software-based products to help fleet operators and industries digitise logistics operations.

359.title: 2 women held with 129 gm suspected brown sugar in Nagaland: Police
359.article_body: Nagaland police arrested two women drug smugglers after recovering suspected brown sugar from them on Monday. Giving details about the incident, Dimapur Police tweeted, "Alert GRPS personnel of Dimapur police during routine checking at the railway station noticed two women moving in a suspicious manner. Upon frisking, the police recovered 129 grams of suspected brown sugar."

360.title: Richa Ghosh smashes the fastest-ever fifty by an Indian woman in ODI cricket off 26 balls
360.article_body: India Women wicketkeeper Richa Ghosh today recorded the fastest-ever fifty by an Indian woman in ODI cricket off 26 balls. The 18-year-old scored a total of 52 runs off 29 deliveries against New Zealand Women in the fourth ODI, which was reduced to 20 overs per side due to rain. The previous record was held by Rumeli Dhar (29 balls).

361.title: Indian Cricketers' Association condemns threat by journalist to Saha, issues statement
361.article_body: The Indian Cricketers' Association (ICA) has condemned the threat issued by a journalist to wicketkeeper Wriddhiman Saha. In a statement, the association urged BCCI to take "strictest possible action in the matter". "Should BCCI feel the need to cancel the erring journalist's accreditation and access to any BCCI event, we'll fully support the move," the association's President Ashok Malhotra said.

362.title: Father, daughter electrocuted after live wire falls on them in MP
362.article_body: A 40-year-old man and his six-year-old daughter died of electrocution after a live wire from an electric pole fell on them in Madhya Pradesh's Balaghat on Monday. The wire broke off the pole following a spark when they were sitting in their home's courtyard, police said. According to electricity department, the fault occurred due to movement of squirrels on pole.

363.title: Govt blocks apps, website of 'Punjab Politics TV' linked to banned group
363.article_body: The government has ordered blocking of apps, websites and social media accounts of foreign-based 'Punjab Politics TV'. It said the channel has close links with Sikhs For Justice (SFJ), which has been declared unlawful under the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act, 1967. "The channel was attempting to use online media to disturb public order during...ongoing State Assembly elections," it added.

364.title: What an achievement: Ashwin on Praggnanandhaa beating Carlsen
364.article_body: India off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin took to Twitter to congratulate 16-year-old Indian Grandmaster R Praggnanandhaa after he defeated world number one Magnus Carlsen in Airthings Masters, an online rapid chess tournament. "What an achievement from Praggnanandhaa to beat Carlsen. An achievement the entire country is proud of," tweeted Ashwin. Praggnanandhaa is third Indian to beat Carlsen.

365.title: Hijab row also being looked at in Bajrang Dal activist's murder case: K'taka minister
365.article_body: Over 12 people have been taken into custody by police in connection with the murder of 26-year-old Bajrang Dal activist Harsha in Karnataka's Shivamogga district, state Home Minister Araga Jnanendra said on Tuesday. Jnanendra further said the role of organisations behind the hijab row is also being looked at. "We are taking this case to the logical end," he added.

366.title: Ajay sets reminder for his, Kajol's anniversary, says 'won't forget this time'
366.article_body: Actor Ajay Devgn took to Instagram Stories to share picture of set reminder for his and actress Kajol's wedding anniversary. The reminder has been set for Thursday, February 24. "Iss baar nahi bhoolunga [Won't forget this time]," Ajay wrote. He shared reminder with picture from couple's visit to 'Koffee with Karan' where he had forgotten wedding anniversary date during game.

367.title: 11 arrested for attacking journalists during Odisha panchayat polls
367.article_body: At least 11 persons have been arrested in connection with an attack on journalists during third phase of panchayat polls in Odisha. Three journalists were beaten up by a mob consisting of about 40 people on Sunday while reporting allegations of poll rigging in the Binjharpur area of Jajpur. The trio was rescued and taken to hospital by police.

368.title: Ready to join US-led sanctions on Russia over Ukraine: Japan
368.article_body: Japan said it stood ready to join the US and other G7 nations in imposing sanctions on Russia, if President Vladimir Putin orders an invasion of Ukraine. The announcement comes after Putin ordered troops into two breakaway regions in eastern Ukraine after recognising them as "independent". Putin's decision to recognise the separatist regions is "unacceptable", Japanese PM Fumio Kishida said.

369.title: Today's date is both a palindrome and an ambigram
369.article_body: The date today 22/02/2022 is both a palindrome and an ambigram, as it can be read the same way forward, backward, and upside down. The palindrome and ambigram work for the British date format (dd-mm-yyyy) but not for the US date format (mm-dd-yyyy). The last double (both a palindrome and an ambigram) fell on 12/02/2021.

370.title: Guests at wedding reception get into street fight in Australia; video goes viral
370.article_body: Guests at a wedding reception were seen fighting on a street in Australia, with the video of the brawl going viral online. In the video, a man can be seen charging at a woman as others try to intervene, while, another man can be seen lying unconscious on the road. The incident occurred at The Spit in Mosman.

371.title: Vehicle thief held in Hyd; 2 tractors, tanker worth ₹12 lakh seized
371.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police said on Monday that a 47-year-old vehicle thief has been arrested and two tractors and a tanker worth ₹12 lakh have been seized from his possession. According to the police, the accused is a habitual offender and a notorious property offender. The accused was arrested based on credible information received by police in Meerpet.

372.title: People want controversy but I am much more than that: Nisha on Lock Upp
372.article_body: Actress Nisha Rawal, who was announced as the first contestant of 'Lock Upp' on Monday, said people just keep talking about that "one episode" in her life with her estranged husband, Karan Mehra. "I know it's a bold show and people want controversy but I'm much more than just that," she added. Nisha said that "one incident" doesn't define her.

373.title: Twitter suspends fake accounts in China promoting Beijing Olympics
373.article_body: Twitter has suspended hundreds of fake Chinese accounts that were included in a recent investigation into Chinese Olympic propaganda. The probe found 3,000 fake accounts coordinating to promote the Beijing Olympics, many of which glossed over controversies involving human rights abuses in China. Twitter said the accounts were suspended for violating the "platform manipulation and spam policy".

374.title: 3 booked for attempting to murder BJP workers in Punjab amid polls
374.article_body: Three people have been booked for allegedly attempting to murder BJP workers in Punjab's Ludhiana during state Assembly elections. BJP Ludhiana Central candidate Gurdev Sharma Debi claimed that the accused attacked the party workers after they asked for identification on suspicion that the accused were bogus voters. The accused had come out of the polling booth when the incident occurred.

375.title: 6 workers killed, 12 injured in blast at fireworks factory in Himachal Pradesh's Una
375.article_body: At least six workers were killed in a blast at a fireworks factory in the Bathu industrial area of Himachal Pradesh's Una on Tuesday. Around 12 workers suffered burn injuries and were brought to a nearby hospital in Una. Fire department personnel and district officials are present at the spot for relief and rescue operations, ANI reported.

376.title: PM should keep 'Ghaziabad poet' to identify terrorists: Kejriwal on Vishwas
376.article_body: In a veiled attack at former AAP leader Kumar Vishwas, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said that PM Narendra Modi should remove all Central agencies and keep the 'Ghaziabad poet' on the job to identify terrorists. This comes after Vishwas said, "One day, Kejriwal told me he would either become CM of Punjab or first PM of Khalistan."

377.title: COVID-19 found on imported pork, beef packaging in Hong Kong
377.article_body: Hong Kong authorities said they've found coronavirus in samples taken from the packaging of imports of frozen pork skin from Poland and frozen beef from Brazil. The Centre for Food Safety (CFS) has ordered the importers to dispose of the beef and pork skin from the concerned batches. The CFS will step up inspections of imported food, the government said.

378.title: Will help in safe disposal: Official on Ghaziabad's 1st dog crematorium
378.article_body: The Ghaziabad municipal corporation is likely to commence operations for city's first crematorium for dogs this week. "Till now, people made their own arrangements for the cremation or burial of pets. Even community dogs were buried in open spaces. This facility will help the city with the safe and scientific disposal of dead dogs," Rajendra Tyagi, Raj Nagar councillor, said.

379.title: Public welfare govt can never promote capitalism: Varun Gandhi
379.article_body: BJP MP Varun Gandhi said a "public welfare government" can never promote capitalism as it creates economic inequality. "Just the privatisation of banks and railways will leave five lakh people jobless. With every job that's lost, the hope for lakhs of families diminishes. A public welfare government can never promote capitalism by creating economic inequality at social level," Varun tweeted.

380.title: Really hurt, PCB must take action: Hafeez on Faulkner's allegations
380.article_body: Reacting to James Faulkner's allegations over non-payment of dues by Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB), Mohammad Hafeez said they really "hurt" him as a Pakistani, adding that the PCB must take action. "I was not expecting this from Faulkner. The allegations were wrong," added Hafeez. The PCB had earlier said that Faulkner damaged hotel property in Lahore.

381.title: Dumped by NRI woman, ex-lover leaks her intimate pics in Ahmedabad
381.article_body: A 23-year-old man from Ahmedabad was arrested for allegedly leaking intimate pictures with his ex-girlfriend on social media. The accused had filmed his intimate moments with the woman over the last one year of their relationship. But she broke up with him when she moved to Australia for higher studies. Enraged with this, he leaked her intimate photos online.

382.title: Case under Atrocities Act registered against IIMC Amravati head
382.article_body: A case has been registered against Indian Institute of Mass Communication (IIMC) Amravati's Director, Anil Kumar Saumitra under Atrocities Act, police said. An assistant professor from the college alleged in his complaint that Saumitra would mentally torture and humiliate him in front of students and staff. He also stopped his lectures because he belonged to the Scheduled Caste, he added.

383.title: K'taka hijab case petitioner's brother attacked, father's restaurant vandalised: Police
383.article_body: One of the girls from Udupi, who have approached the Karnataka High Court in the hijab case, has alleged that some miscreants attacked her brother and vandalised her father's restaurant in Malpe. "I demand action be taken against the Sangh Parivar goons," she tweeted. Udupi SP said a windowpane was damaged and one of the miscreants slapped the girl's brother.

384.title: Would've been a nightmare to handle 3 big stars in 'Kai Po Che': Director
384.article_body: As 'Kai Po Che' completed nine years on Tuesday, director Abhishek Kapoor spoke about his decision to cast Sushant Singh Rajput, Amit Sadh and Rajkummar Rao in the film. "We did try to have big names initially...But it wasn't written...that way," he said, adding, "It was about friendship, where they were equals. It would've been...nightmare to handle three big stars."

385.title: SC seeks govt's response on PIL seeking enforcement of citizens' fundamental duties
385.article_body: The Supreme Court sought response from the Centre and states on a plea seeking direction for enacting well-defined laws or rules to ensure adherence of the fundamental duties as enshrined in the Constitution. The court sought directions to the Centre and states for framing of guidelines for taking appropriate steps to sensitise people regarding the fundamental duties under the Constitution.

386.title: Reporter covers Russia-Ukraine crisis in six languages; video goes viral
386.article_body: A video of a journalist's six-language coverage of the tensions between Russia and Ukraine has gone viral on social media. The video compilation shared by Associated Press Global Media Services' Philip Crowther showed him reporting for various news organisations in English, Luxembourgish, Spanish, Portuguese, French and German. He's currently in Ukraine's capital Kiev, reporting on the crisis.

387.title: Netherlands fines Apple $5.7 mn, its 5th such penalty in weeks
387.article_body: The Netherlands has fined Apple $5.7 million, the fifth such penalty in successive weeks in a row, over access to non-Apple payment methods for subscriptions to dating apps. The ACM said Apple is abusing its position by not allowing developers to use other methods. It has been levying weekly fines of $5.7 million since Apple missed a January 15 deadline.

388.title: Shameful that Bajrang Dal activist killed in BJP-ruled state: BJP MP
388.article_body: After Bajrang Dal activist Harsha's killing in Karnataka, BJP MP from Mysuru-Kodagu, Pratap Simha said it was very painful to see Harsha's body but at the same time, it was shameful that even after the BJP government came to power, the same situation continues. "When all our workers were murdered, we used to blame KFD...Now it's our government," Simha stated.

389.title: 2 of late Indian painter Raja Ravi Varma's paintings sell as NFTs for over ₹1 crore
389.article_body: Late Indian painter Raja Ravi Varma's two paintings, 'The Coquette' and 'Reclining Nair Lady', have been sold for $74,999 (about ₹56 lakh) and $63,999 (about ₹47 lakh) as NFTs in an auction held from February 17 to 20. The auction was conducted by RtistiQ, a physical and digital art marketplace. It is not known who has bought the two NFTs.

390.title: We are ready to defend ourselves: Ukraine amid Russia invasion threat
390.article_body: Amid Russian invasion threat, Ukraine Defence Minister Oleksii Reznikov said, "We remain confident and calm. We are ready and able to defend ourselves and our sovereignty." His statement comes after Russian President Vladimir Putin recognised two breakaway regions in Ukraine as independent. Putin also ordered the deployment of soldiers, whom he called "peacemakers", to the regions.

391.title: South Korean drama 'Something in the Rain' to get Indian remake
391.article_body: 'Something in the Rain', a South Korean drama series starring Jung Hae In and Son Ye Jin, is set for an Indian adaptation. "We've recently confirmed...production of Indian remake of 'Something In the Rain' with Pocket Aces," JTBC Studio, the production house behind the original show, said in a statement. Pocket Aces is known for its four-season series 'Little Things'.

392.title: Question is how much cricket will he play: Karthik on Rohit being all-format captain
392.article_body: Wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik has said while Rohit Sharma, who has now been named India captain across formats, is a quality captain, the question is how much cricket is the 34-year-old going to play. "I think Rohit is very astute tactically...He is a quality captain...there's no doubt about that," Karthik added. Rohit will lead India in two-Test series against Sri Lanka.

393.title: Man who asked 3 people to not talk loudly during movie in Maha attacked
393.article_body: A 24-year-old man, Saurabh Bhoir, was attacked by three people with soda bottles outside a movie theatre in Maharashtra after he and his friends told them to not talk loudly during movie. "During interval...nine to ten people...started assaulting us...Theatre management stopped them...called police...When we left and were near the gate, they started throwing soda bottles on us," Bhoir said.

394.title: 2-yr-old dies as father kicks her to ground during fight with wife in UP
394.article_body: A 2-year-old girl died after her father allegedly kicked her to ground during fight with his wife in Uttar Pradesh's Firozabad. Officials said family members were making arrangements to "hurriedly bury" her body. Police reached the spot and body was sent for post-mortem. The girl's grandfather said she suffered critical injuries. Meanwhile, police said she was declared dead at hospital.

395.title: Salman saw potential in me even when I didn't know I had: Deepika
395.article_body: Discussing her relationship with Salman Khan, Deepika Padukone said they have always had a "beautiful" relationship, adding, "He saw potential in me even when I didn't know I had." "I will always be grateful to Salman because he was one of the first to offer me a film," stated Deepika. Deepika, Salman are yet to star together in a film.

396.title: Playing my character in 'Love Hostel' tormented me: Vikrant Massey
396.article_body: Terming his character in the upcoming film 'Love Hostel' as one whose portrayal left him "awake" for most nights, actor Vikrant Massey said playing his character in the film "really tormented" his mind. "It was a turbulent time...as I was going through a lot," added Vikrant. Vikrant and Sanya Malhotra play a newly married couple on the run.

397.title: Pune BJP corporator quits party, alleges leaders didn't allow her to work
397.article_body: A BJP corporator Chanda Lokhande from Pimple Gurav within the Pune's Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation limits has quit the party. BJP corporators and leaders did not allow her to work, Lokhande alleged. Notably, the term of the current civic body ends on March 13. The Maharashtra government has been left with no choice but to appoint an administrator, civic officials said.

398.title: No better multi-skilled cricketer than Ravindra Jadeja: Sanjay Bangar
398.article_body: Sanjay Bangar said there is no better "multi-skilled" cricketer than Ravindra Jadeja, adding that it will be a toss-up between Jadeja and Shardul Thakur for the all-rounder's role in India's T20I setup. "Jadeja's batting has been on the rise...and him being a left-hander can add that right-left sort of combination in the lower order as well," stated Bangar.

399.title: SC to hear plea seeking cancellation of offline Class 10 & 12 board exams tomorrow
399.article_body: The Supreme Court (SC) has agreed to hear a plea seeking the cancellation of physical exams for classes 10 and 12 to be conducted by all state boards, CBSE, ICSE and National Institute of Open Schooling (NIOS). The plea will be heard by a bench led by Justice AM Khanwilkar on Wednesday, Chief Justice of India (CJI) NV Ramana said.

400.title: What Dravid did, that's the way it should be done: Aakash on Wriddhiman Saha
400.article_body: Talking about the controversy over Wriddhiman Saha, commentator Aakash Chopra said head coach Rahul Dravid did the "correct thing" informing Saha about getting dropped. "The truth is that Dravid was absolutely honest...when someone has played for India, you keep your hand on his shoulders and tell him the truth that the selectors...are looking in a different direction," Aakash added.

401.title: Largest ever solar eruption captured by Solar Orbiter spacecraft
401.article_body: The largest solar prominence eruption ever observed was captured in a single image together with the complete solar disk by NASA and European Space Agency (ESA) joint project, Solar Orbiter spacecraft. The Full Sun Imager (FSI) of the Extreme Ultraviolet Imager (EUI) on orbiter captured the image. The eruption apparently originated from the side of sun, facing away from earth.
